Package core

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Board class is responsible for keeping track of the pawns on the board.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jose Solis

    • Method Detail

      • addPawns

        public void addPawns​(java.util.ArrayList<core.Pawn> pawns)
        This method adds a collection of pawns to the board. Used in conjunction when creating a player's pawns.
        Parameters:
        pawns - ArrayList collection of pawns to add to the board.

      • getPawn

        public core.Pawn getPawn​(int row,
                         int col)
        This method returns the pawn at the given row and col. It returns null if the row and col is "empty". The idea is each space on the "8x8" can only have one pawn. A pawn can only move to a new space if it is "empty". Empty means there is no pawn at that space or if there is a pawn it must be captured to treat the space as empty.
        Parameters:
        row - int row of the pawn to return.
        col - int col of the pawn to return.
        Returns:
        Pawn pawn at the given row and col, null if there is no pawn at the given row and col.

      • isPositionValid

        public boolean isPositionValid​(int row,
                               int col)
        This method checks if the given row and col is a valid position on the board. Useful for checking if a pawn can move to a new position.
        Parameters:
        row - int row to check.
        col - int col to check.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the row and col is a valid position on the board, false otherwise. Does not check if the position is empty.

      • canPlayerMove

        public boolean canPlayerMove​(Player player)
        This method checks if the given player can move any of their pawns. Useful for checking if the game is over.
        Parameters:
        player - Player player to check if they can move any of their pawns.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the player can move any of their pawns, false otherwise.

      • canPawnMoveForward

        public boolean canPawnMoveForward​(Direction direction,
                                  core.Pawn pawn)
        This method checks if the given pawn can move forward. A pawn can move forward if there is an empty space in front of it. Useful for checking if the game is over or if the computer can perform a move with its pawn.
        Parameters:
        direction - Direction direction of the pawn.
        pawn - Pawn pawn to check if it can move forward.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the pawn can move forward, false otherwise.

      • isCapturePossible

        public boolean isCapturePossible​(Direction direction,
                                 core.Pawn pawn)
        This method checks if the given pawn can capture another pawn. A pawn can capture another pawn if there is an empty space two spaces in front of it and there is an enemy pawn one space in front of it. Useful for checking if the game is over or if the computer can perform a capture with its pawn.
        Parameters:
        direction - Direction direction of the pawn.
        pawn - Pawn pawn to check if it can capture another pawn.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the pawn can capture another pawn, false otherwise.

      • movePawn

        public boolean movePawn​(Direction direction,
                        int row,
                        int col,
                        int newRow,
                        int newCol)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method moves the pawn at the given row and col to the new row and col. The pawn can only move forward or capture another pawn. If the pawn is captured, it is marked as captured (soft delete).
        Parameters:
        direction - Direction direction of the pawn.
        row - int row of the pawn.
        col - int col of the pawn.
        newRow - int new row of the pawn.
        newCol - int new col of the pawn.
        Returns:
        boolean This method returns true if the pawn made a capture AND another capture is possible, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the pawn cannot move to the new position.
